channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Fancy an all-inclusive trip to The Perl Conference next year*?
item.description: This role may be your ticket to enjoying The Perl Conference next year without spending a penny of your own money!

item.title: Love independent music? Hipster not a dirty word to you? Drive forward independent music with Perl in London
item.description: Help build out a Modern Perl platform ahead of international expansion with a team looking to make a difference

item.title: London's Trendiest Office Space - Lead and Mid-Level Perl Developer roles
item.description: if your hacking requires beautiful but functional surroundings, youâ€™re in luck

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: 2018.30 Triplicate Guts
item.description: The weekly awesome.

item.title: Faster Perl 6 Programs
item.description: Zoffix gave talk on "Faster Perl 6 Programs" at the Toronto Perl Mongers. It is must watch for every Perl enthusiasts.

item.title: Intro Into Perl 6 Regexes and Grammars
item.description: Incredible insights into Perl 6 Regexes and Grammars by our very own Perl 6 guru, Zoffix. It was presented last week at the Toronto Perl Mongers.

item.title: The Future of Perl 5
item.description: Ovid discussing the features that he expects in future Perl 5.

item.title: Tech Jargon: The good, the bad, and the ugly
item.description: Is jargon inclusive or exclusive? It depends on the context.

item.title: Alien package for the Colored ASCII Art library
item.description: Contribute to Alien::caca development by creating an account on GitHub.

item.title: Is your website HTTPS enabled?
item.description: Half the web isn't encrypted and Google Chrome is now going to clearly show you which sites aren't up to scratch.

item.title: Logical Styling Based On the Number of Given Elements
item.description: Did you know that CSS is Turing complete? Did you know that you can use it to do some pretty serious logical styling? Well you can! You donâ€™t have to set all of your logic-based styling rules in JavaScript, or even have to use JavaScript to set classes you are styling against.

item.title: Tested Joined Moose
item.description: Some joined Moose testing for you by @byterock.

item.title: Selecting the Right Languages for Your Web Applications
item.description: Download the guide by ActiveState.

item.title: Clean, DRY, SOLID Spaghetti
item.description: A very thought provoking discussion on the topic of TDD, DRY and SOLID. It has explored ideas that I never thought of before.

item.title: Do you want to enable HTTPS?
item.description: Easy to use guide how to enable HTTPS.

item.title: The Garbage Collector
item.description: Get the inner details of garbage collection by none other than by TimoTimo himself. I had the pleasure of meeting him personally at the German Perl Workshop 2018. It is worth reading if the subject fancy you.

item.title: Perl 6 Tutorial at TPC in Glasgow
item.description: DrForr is giving training on Perl 6. There is still time left to join the course. Please join now.

item.title: StickerYou.com is offering 10% off to the Perl Weekly community. Forever.
item.description: StickerYou is your one-stop shop to make your business branding stick. You can create custom stickers, labels, decals, magnets, patches, badges, iron-ons and more in any size, shape, and order quantity. If youâ€™re printing custom vinyl stickers for your business, StickerYou.com has you covered. Use code PERL10 at checkout for a 10% discount.

item.title: #366 - The Future of Perl 5
item.description:
Hi there,

As always, Curtis Ovid, started interesting discussion with regard to what features we wanted in Perl 5.

Interesting take on Tech Jargon. I always wonder why even technical user misuse it so much.

Anyone interested in the internals of Perl 5 engine? Michael Conrad gives brief overview.

Last but not the least, nearly 2 weeks left for The Perl Conference in Glasgow. Please do come and join the celebration. If you haven't booked your ticket yet then please do buy your ticket without any further delay.

Enjoy reading this week newsletter. Please do share your suggestions to improve the newsletter.
